abstract.p: France Telecom SA is planning initial public offering for its mobile unit in its fourth quarter; photo (S)

block.p: The French telephone giant France Telecom S.A. is planning an initial public offering for its mobile unit in its fourth quarter, according to its chief executive, Michel Bon. The company expects to raise 14 billion euros. The mobile unit will include Orange P.L.C., Britain's third-largest mobile operator, which France Telecom acquired for $37.5 billion in June. The sale will be France Telecom's second this year; it raised 1.9 billion euros from selling shares in Wanadoo S.A., its Internet division.

The French telephone giant France Telecom S.A. is planning an initial public offering for its mobile unit in its fourth quarter, according to its chief executive, Michel Bon. The company expects to raise 14 billion euros. The mobile unit will include Orange P.L.C., Britain's third-largest mobile operator, which France Telecom acquired for $37.5 billion in June. The sale will be France Telecom's second this year; it raised 1.9 billion euros from selling shares in Wanadoo S.A., its Internet division.
